Structural Smell Detector

class code_quality_analyzer.structural_smell_detector.StructuralSmell(name: str, description: str, file_path: str, module_class: str, line_number: int = None, severity: str = '')[source]

Bases: object

Represents a detected structural smell in the code.

name

The name of the structural smell.

Type:

str

description

A description of the detected smell.

Type:

str

file_path

The path to the file where the smell was detected.

Type:

str

The module or class where the smell was detected.

Type:

str

line_number

The line number where the smell was detected.

Type:

int, optional

severity

The severity level of the smell.

Type:

str, optional

class code_quality_analyzer.structural_smell_detector.StructuralSmellDetector(config)[source]

Bases: object

A class to detect structural smells in Python code.

This class analyzes Python source code files to identify various structural code smells based on predefined thresholds.

structural_smells

A list to store detected structural smells.

Type:

list

class_info

A dictionary to store information about classes.

Type:

defaultdict

module_info

A dictionary to store information about modules.

Type:

defaultdict

dependency_graph

A directed graph to represent module dependencies.

Type:

nx.DiGraph

thresholds

A dictionary of threshold values for various smell detections.

Type:

dict

project_root

The root directory of the project being analyzed.

Type:

str

file_paths

A dictionary to store file paths of modules and classes.

Type:

dict

add_smell(name, description, file_path, module_class, line_number=None)[source]

Add a detected smell to the list of structural smells.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the structural smell.

  • description (str) – A description of the detected smell.

  • file_path (str) – The path to the file where the smell was detected.

  • module_class (str) – The module or class where the smell was detected.

  • line_number (int, optional) – The line number where the smell was detected.

analyze_class(node, module_name)[source]

Analyze a class definition node and extract relevant information.

Parameters:

  • node (ast.ClassDef) – The class definition node to analyze.

  • module_name (str) – The name of the module containing the class.

analyze_directory(directory_path)[source]

Analyze all Python files in the given directory and its subdirectories.

Parameters:

directory_path (str) – The path to the directory to be analyzed.

analyze_file(file_path)[source]

Analyze a single Python file for structural information.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The path to the Python file to be analyzed.

analyze_method(node, class_name)[source]

Analyze a method definition node and extract relevant information.

Parameters:

  • node (ast.FunctionDef) – The method definition node to analyze.

  • class_name (str) – The name of the class containing the method.

calculate_cyclomatic_complexity(method_node)[source]

Calculate the cyclomatic complexity of a method.

Parameters:

method_node (ast.FunctionDef) – The AST node of the method.

Returns:

The cyclomatic complexity of the method.

Return type:

int

calculate_max_nesting_depth(node, current_depth=0)[source]

Calculate the maximum nesting depth of a given AST node.

Parameters:

  • node (ast.AST) – The AST node to analyze.

  • current_depth (int) – The current nesting depth.

Returns:

The maximum nesting depth found in the node and its children.

Return type:

int

check_identifier_length(class_name, identifier, line_number=None)[source]

Check if an identifier’s length is within the acceptable range.

Parameters:

  • class_name (str) – The name of the class containing the identifier.

  • identifier (str) – The identifier to check.

  • line_number (int, optional) – The line number where the identifier is defined.

detect_branches()[source]

Detect methods with too many branches.

This method identifies methods that exceed the maximum number of branches threshold. Branches include if statements, for loops, while loops, and try-except blocks.

detect_cbo()[source]

Detect modules with high Coupling Between Object Classes (CBO).

This method calculates the CBO metric (number of other classes a class is coupled to) for each module and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_cyclomatic_complexity()[source]

Detect methods with high cyclomatic complexity.

This method calculates the cyclomatic complexity of each method and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_dit()[source]

Detect classes with a Deep Inheritance Tree (DIT).

This method calculates the depth of inheritance tree for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_fanin()[source]

Detect modules with high fan-in.

This method calculates the fan-in (number of incoming dependencies) for each module and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_fanout()[source]

Detect modules with high fan-out.

This method calculates the fan-out (number of outgoing dependencies) for each module and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_file_length()[source]

Detect files with excessive length.

This method identifies files that exceed the maximum file length threshold.

detect_identifier_length()[source]

Detect identifiers (class names, method names, field names) that are too short or too long.

This method identifies identifiers that are shorter than the minimum or longer than the maximum identifier length thresholds.

detect_lcom()[source]

Detect classes with high Lack of Cohesion of Methods (LCOM).

This method calculates the LCOM metric for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold. LCOM is calculated as the difference between the number of method pairs not sharing instance variables and the number of method pairs sharing instance variables.

detect_loc()[source]

Detect modules with high Lines of Code (LOC).

This method counts the number of lines in each module and identifies those exceeding the LOC threshold.

detect_method_length()[source]

Detect methods with excessive length.

This method identifies methods that exceed the maximum method length threshold.

detect_mpc()[source]

Detect classes with high Message Passing Coupling (MPC).

This method calculates the MPC metric (number of method calls to other classes) for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_nesting_depth()[source]

Detect methods with excessive nesting depth.

This method identifies methods that exceed the maximum nesting depth threshold.

detect_noc()[source]

Detect projects with a high Number of Classes (NOC).

This method counts the total number of classes in the project and identifies if it exceeds the NOC threshold.

detect_nocc()[source]

Detect modules with a high Number of Classes (NOCC).

This method counts the number of classes in each module and identifies those exceeding the NOCC threshold.

detect_nom()[source]

Detect classes with a high Number of Methods (NOM).

This method identifies classes that exceed the NOM threshold and adds them to the structural smells list.

detect_parameters()[source]

Detect methods with too many parameters.

This method identifies methods that exceed the maximum number of parameters threshold.

detect_returns()[source]

Detect methods with too many return statements.

This method identifies methods that exceed the maximum number of return statements threshold.

detect_rfc()[source]

Detect classes with high Response for a Class (RFC).

This method calculates the RFC metric (number of methods + number of distinct method calls) for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_size2()[source]

Detect large classes based on the SIZE2 metric.

This method calculates the SIZE2 metric (sum of methods and fields) for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_smells(directory_path)[source]

Detect structural smells in the given directory.

This method analyzes all Python files in the given directory and its subdirectories, and runs various smell detection methods.

Parameters:

directory_path (str) – The path to the directory to be analyzed.

detect_wac()[source]

Detect classes with high Weight of a Class (WAC).

This method counts the number of fields in each class and identifies those exceeding the WAC threshold.

detect_wmpc()[source]

Detect classes with high Weighted Methods per Class (WMPC).

This method calculates both WMPC1 (based on cyclomatic complexity) and WMPC2 (based on number of parameters) for each class and identifies those exceeding the respective thresholds.

load_thresholds(config)[source]

Load threshold values from the given configuration.

Parameters:

config (dict or str) – Either a dictionary of thresholds or a path to a YAML config file.

Returns:

A dictionary of threshold values.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError – If the config is neither a dictionary nor a valid file path.

print_report()[source]

Print a report of all detected structural smells.

resolve_base_class(base_node, current_module)[source]

Resolve the full name of a base class.

Parameters:

  • base_node (ast.expr) – The AST node representing the base class.

  • current_module (str) – The name of the current module.

Returns:

The full name of the base class.

Return type:

str

code_quality_analyzer.structural_smell_detector.analyze_structure(directory_path, config)[source]

Analyze the structural smells in a given directory.

Parameters:

  • directory_path (str) – The path to the directory to analyze.

  • config (dict or str) – Either a dictionary of thresholds or a path to a YAML config file.
